title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.18 | 1-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The transcendental form of the Lord, as it is, satisfies the mind's desire and at once erases all mental incongruities.
segments.summary: This segment explains the meaning of the verse, focusing on how the transcendental form of the Lord satisfies the mind and removes mental incongruities, as experienced by Narada Muni.

segments.key_quote: Nirakar means the Lord does not have a material form.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Narada Muni's experience of seeing the Lord's form, contrasting it with the common understanding of God being formless (Nirakar), and clarifying that Nirakar means the Lord doesn't have a material form, but a transcendental one, which cannot be seen with material eyes.

segments.key_quote: One who has once seen that form is not satisfied with anything else.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that Narada Muni saw the transcendental form through spiritual endeavor, highlighting the unique ability of the Lord's form to completely satisfy the mind and erase mental incongruities, unlike any material form.

segments.key_quote: As spiritual beings, having eternal relations with that transcendental form of the Lord, we are life after life searching after that form of the Lord.
segments.summary: This segment reiterates the meaning of Nirakar, explains that we are eternally searching for the Lord's spiritual form, and describes Narada Muni's reaction of perturbation upon losing sight of that form.

segments.key_quote: For the soul there is no death, there is no birth.
segments.summary: This segment explains the concept of reincarnation and the continuous search for the transcendental form of the Lord due to spiritual ignorance, emphasizing the struggle for existence in the material world.

segments.key_quote: Though the deity is Krishna, the deity is completely spiritual, but unless our eyes are trained, unless we have got spiritual training, unless we have developed the spiritual vision, we cannot see the spiritual form of the deity.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the deity form in the temple, explaining that without proper spiritual training and vision, one may perceive it as merely a material statue, failing to recognize its spiritual essence.
